required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Clinical Characteristics, Management and Prognosis of Patients Developing Intraoperative Cardiac Arrest During Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: The Clinical Characteristics, Management and Prognosis of Patients Developing Intraoperative Cardiac Arrest During Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study was aimed to investigate the clinical characteristics, management and prognosis of patients developing intraoperative cardiac arrest during transcatheter aortic valve implantation

clinical_study.condition: Cardiac Arrest, Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation

arm_group.description: Including patients developing intraoperative cardiac arrest during transcatheter aortic valve implantation from January 2014 to May 2019

intervention.description: None additional intervention was applied to the subjects.

study_pop.textblock: patients who developed intraoperative cardiac arrest during transcatheter aortic valve implantation from January 2014 to May 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: patients who developed intraoperative cardiac arrest during transcatheter aortic valve implantation from January 2014 to May 2019 -
Exclusion Criteria: None.
-

facility.name: Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University, School of Medicine
